revisions:
[{'created': '2019-07-02 01:59:14.000000000', 'message': '[WIP] Pep8 environment to run on delta code only

Currently tox -epep8 will run flake8 on whole code.
To make this fast, flake8 support is added for only
updated(delta) code. Same can be run by "tox -efast8".

It also determines how many commits to check based on the
$FAST8_NUM_COMMITS env variable. If set to "smart",
it uses git to try to run against all unsubmitted commits.
This allows fast8 to be more useful when actively
developing a series of patches.

Closes-Bug: #1833271
Change-Id: Icb5c7bbb2f020105ef754796ac9bf695c6ad6151
'}]
commit_message:
[WIP] Pep8 environment to run on delta code only

Currently tox -epep8 will run flake8 on whole code.
To make this fast, flake8 support is added for only
updated(delta) code. Same can be run by "tox -efast8".

It also determines how many commits to check based on the
$FAST8_NUM_COMMITS env variable. If set to "smart",
it uses git to try to run against all unsubmitted commits.
This allows fast8 to be more useful when actively
developing a series of patches.

Closes-Bug: #1833271
Change-Id: Icb5c7bbb2f020105ef754796ac9bf695c6ad6151

commit_message:
Adds confirmation pop-up at modal window closing

Modal windows rendered by wizardForm component in Horizon, i.e.
"Create Image" an be closed accidentally without confirmation. Proposed
patch adds confirmation pop-up preventing this issue. Esc key is not
handled and closes modal without confirmation. Handling Esc is
separate issue

Closes-bug: #1818213
Change-Id: Ib67cbdf47acbab8ea18ac8475ce60b42e415d758

[{'created': '2019-04-24 09:43:23.000000000', 'message': 'Volume Group name field should be optional

As per cinder documentation[1], name is an optional field while
creating a group, however it is marked mandatory in horizon.
This patch makes it optional allowing users to create
groups without specifying group name.

[1] https://docs.openstack.org/python-cinderclient/latest/cli/details.html#cinder-group-create

Change-Id: Ibe9b4dfb1febae5295df13f61310b57a3733cb1a

'}, {'created': '2019-04-30 10:49:25.000000000', 'message': "Marking name field optional

As per cinder documentation[1], name is an optional field while
creating a group, however it is marked mandatory in horizon.

This patch marks it and all similar instances optional to allow users
to create resources without name field where it isn't mandatory.

[1] https://docs.openstack.org/python-cinderclient/latest/cli/details.html#cinder-group-create

Change-Id: Ibe9b4dfb1febae5295df13f61310b57a3733cb1a
Closes-Bug: #1826156
"}]
commit_message:
Marking name field optional

As per cinder documentation[1], name is an optional field while
creating a group, however it is marked mandatory in horizon.

This patch marks it and all similar instances optional to allow users
to create resources without name field where it isn't mandatory.

[1] https://docs.openstack.org/python-cinderclient/latest/cli/details.html#cinder-group-create

Change-Id: Ibe9b4dfb1febae5295df13f61310b57a3733cb1a
Closes-Bug: #1826156

commit_message:
Rocky: enable container auth support

Squash of adding container enginene support and the subsequent fix

1) Add container engine authentication support

See I98a527f363056767fea45ab4828ae61c01de20ca. This is only the docker
support as podman was added in Stein

2) Convert the heat json format to a py dict

This change converts a heat json format option to a py dict within
a jinja expresion.

Closes-Bug: #1835657
Related-Bug: #1833584
Change-Id: I4b44214cd7007dc31ad5f4e0a0d7a3a531a9f20e
Signed-off-by: Kevin Carter <kecarter@redhat.com>
(cherry picked from commit 6e07f2a7675b2dd8ff340a24823eb3808d2b07b3)
(cherry picked from commit d6bd20d5b46d7ede598e022f0d34814c8dbe8a66)

commit_message:
Stop and disable libvirtd service on controller

The libvirtd service is enabled and running unnecessarily on
controller node.
This change disables and stop the libvirtd service on controller
nodes.

Change-Id: Iaabaf571f6ec3c08db16a309a845d3bd4c150e1a
(cherry picked from commit 6a1b92d402f427e558101589e6d8145f880b2ccf)
(cherry picked from commit c89fe3cd9285c0bde97ceeebe9053fdc3a30b7d7)

revisions:
[{'created': '2019-07-05 08:45:12.000000000', 'message': "Define the Integrated-gate-storage gate template

tempest-full job run all services API and scenario tests (non slow)
and this job is part of Integrated-gate gate template which run on
multiple services (nova, neutron, cinder, glance, placement) check
and gate pipeline.

But there are many unrelated tests run on each project gate. For example,
neutron gate run cinder only tests and fail due to cinder bugs. There is
no point of breaking the neutron gate due to cinder only test failure and
slow down the neutron development phase.

This is what we dicussed in Train PTG in denver to improve the integrated
gate[1] and came up with idea of split the integated-gate template into
much logical way so that only dependent services tests run on their gate.

One way was to move the service only tests to service tempest plugin side
but Tempest is used by interop as well as on production cloud testing so
moving the test is not good idea.

This commit propose the idea of defining the 'Integrated-gate-storage'
gate template for neutron gate which will run only nova and neutron tests.

ML discussion: http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-discuss/2019-May/005871.html

Next step will be to replace the Integrated-gate-py3 template with new
Integrated-gate-storage template on cinder and glance gate.

[1] https://etherpad.openstack.org/p/qa-train-ptg

Change-Id: Iae7d26325228aad0edb94f7e191c8fd0d60e1362
"}, {'created': '2019-07-05 19:37:00.000000000', 'message': "Define the Integrated-gate-storage gate template

much logical way so that only dependent services tests run on their gate.

One way was to move the service only tests to service tempest plugin side
but Tempest is used by interop as well as on production cloud testing so
moving the test is not good idea.

This commit propose the idea of defining the 'Integrated-gate-storage'
gate template for cinder gate which will run Cinder, Glance, Swift and
Nova tests.

ML discussion: http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-discuss/2019-May/005871.html

Next step will be to replace the Integrated-gate-py3 template with new
Integrated-gate-storage template on cinder and glance gate.

[1] https://etherpad.openstack.org/p/qa-train-ptg

Change-Id: Iae7d26325228aad0edb94f7e191c8fd0d60e1362

commit_message:
Define the Integrated-gate-storage gate template

tempest-full job run all services API and scenario tests (non slow)
and this job is part of Integrated-gate gate template which run on
multiple services (nova, neutron, cinder, glance, placement) check
and gate pipeline.

But there are many unrelated tests run on each project gate. For example,
neutron gate run cinder only tests and fail due to cinder bugs. There is
no point of breaking the neutron gate due to cinder only test failure and
slow down the neutron development phase.

This is what we dicussed in Train PTG in denver to improve the integrated
gate[1] and came up with idea of split the integated-gate template into
much logical way so that only dependent services tests run on their gate.

One way was to move the service only tests to service tempest plugin side
but Tempest is used by interop as well as on production cloud testing so
moving the test is not good idea.

This commit propose the idea of defining the 'Integrated-gate-storage'
gate template for cinder gate which will run Cinder, Glance, Swift and
Nova tests.

ML discussion: http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-discuss/2019-May/005871.html

Next step will be to replace the Integrated-gate-py3 template with new
Integrated-gate-storage template on cinder and glance gate.

[1] https://etherpad.openstack.org/p/qa-train-ptg

Change-Id: Iae7d26325228aad0edb94f7e191c8fd0d60e1362

This is not the same. Your patch is removing the use if the root helper by default, something I don't agree with. This patch is only removing the use of the privsep helper (something different from the rootwrap deamon) only in functional tests and for an specific method.

Both patches are not linked."}, {'account_id': 11975, 'date': '2019-07-04 14:11:33.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

I agree with Rodolfo here. This patch is only changing this config option for one test job and Liu's patch is changing default value of options which I'm also not sure if is good idea in this case."}, {'account_id': 9531, 'date': '2019-07-04 14:25:08.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

> > > Why do not speed up this forever:

 > > helper by default, something I don't agree with. This patch is

 > > removing the use of the privsep helper (something different from

 > >
 > > Both patches are not linked.
 > 
 > I agree with Rodolfo here. This patch is only changing this config
 > option for one test job and Liu's patch is changing default value
 > of options which I'm also not sure if is good idea in this case.

You guys have not convinced me in such something reason. Let me give some specific reasons why I do not agree this patch:
1. As I mentioned before, L3 agent is multi-thread, your change here is some proof that just reflects that the current default value is incorrect.
2. We should use the better value for common use, that `security settings` related system is more like a rare case.
3. We have inconsistence between `use_helper_for_ns_read` and `root_helper_daemon`. `use_helper_for_ns_read` is True by default which means it uses `root helper deamon` for list namespace only. But for more common config `root_helper_daemon` is empty by default, which means every external command execution will start a child process. Why we does not consider that `security settings` for this common config?"}, {'account_id': 16688, 'date': '2019-07-04 14:33:57.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

 > 1. As I mentioned before, L3 agent is multi-thread, your change

 > 2. We should use the better value for common use, that `security

 > 3. We have inconsistence between `use_helper_for_ns_read` and
 > `root_helper_daemon`. `use_helper_for_ns_read` is True by default
 > which means it uses `root helper deamon` for list namespace only.
 > But for more common config `root_helper_daemon` is empty by
 > default, which means every external command execution will start a
 > child process. Why we does not consider that `security settings`
 > for this common config?

Please, don't mix privsep and rootwrap. Both things are different
- This change is removing the need of using privsep when listing the namespaces, just for FT.
- Your patch is removing the rootwrap daemon (!= privsep) by default in any deployment.

If "use_helper_for_ns_read", ip_lib will call a privsep decorated function, it won't use the rootwrap daemon:
  @privileged.default.entrypoint
  def list_netns(**kwargs):
    ...

Both patches have no link at all. Please, remember rootwrap != privsep [1]

[1] https://specs.openstack.org/openstack/oslo-specs/specs/liberty/privsep.html'}, {'account_id': 11975, 'date': '2019-07-04 14:40:04.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

But lets discuss about Your other patch in review of Your patch, not here :)'}, {'account_id': 16688, 'date': '2019-07-04 15:10:30.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2.'}, {'account_id': 16688, 'date': '2019-07-04 15:11:12.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2:

Sorry, I didn't change the change-id."}, {'account_id': 16688, 'date': '2019-07-04 15:12:24.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 3.'}, {'account_id': 9531, 'date': '2019-07-04 15:41:23.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 3: Code-Review-1

Sorry, one more thing, why list namespace action needs to be privileged? According to these search:
https://github.com/search?q=org%3Aopenstack+listnetns&type=Code
https://github.com/search?q=org%3Aopenstack+list_network_namespaces&type=Code
We have no `nspath` input for any call place. `ip netns` and 'ls /var/run/netns' can be run in CentOS7 by default. So maybe we can remove such silly config for list namespace.

-1 is still active plus with my former 3 reasons."}, {'account_id': 16688, 'date': '2019-07-04 16:12:20.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3:

> Sorry, one more thing, why list namespace action needs to be
 > privileged? According to these search:
 > https://github.com/search?q=org%3Aopenstack+listnetns&type=Code
 > https://github.com/search?q=org%3Aopenstack+list_network_namespaces&type=Code
 > We have no `nspath` input for any call place. `ip netns` and 'ls
 > /var/run/netns' can be run in CentOS7 by default. So maybe we can
 > remove such silly config for list namespace.
 > 
 > -1 is still active plus with my former 3 reasons.

The previous 3 reasons are not valid, as commented before. rootwrap is not privsep.
1) No, this patch doesn't prove anything about the rootwrap daemon. I'm removing the privsep context call (privsep daemon, btw, is multithread).

2) That's why I'm changing this only for FT, because I don't want to change the default value but there is not need to have it in FT.

3) No, "use_helper_for_ns_read" does not imply the use of rootwrap, as you can read here [1]. "use_helper_for_ns_read" implies the use of root_helper, in this case privsep.



"list_network_namespaces" can be used, in a future, pointing to a different directory.

You can have a user with restricted access to "/var/run/netns/", that's why we need to make this call through the privsep context.


[1] https://github.com/openstack/neutron/blob/master/neutron/cmd/sanity_check.py#L91-L94'}, {'account_id': 26622, 'date': '2019-07-04 20:21:18.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3:

commit_message:
Do not use privsep context when listing the namespaces in functional

The aim of this patch is to speed up the namespace listing and
avoid overloading the privsep daemon during the functional tests.

Change-Id: Icd1de10a3a58d2c46d5400db95c2cd84809d6221
Related-Bug: #1833717
Related-Bug: #1811515

commit_message:
Use openstack-python-jobs to run pep8 and py27 test

1. Use openstack-python-jobs template to run pep8 and py27[1]
2. Add the license info for requirements.txt

[1]: refer to https://docs.openstack.org/infra/openstack-zuul-jobs/project-templates.html#

Change-Id: I7612fa970a82b3ed16ab88ace82af4fcfabfc1a7

commit_message:
Add host and hypervisor_hostname to create servers

Adds the --host and --hypervisor-hostname options to
the nova boot command and related python API bindings.

I'm thinking you could split out some of the nova helper and grafana client type stuff into separate changes, and then have the new datasource code come last."}, {'account_id': 29911, 'date': '2019-05-14 15:18:14.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 11:

> I know this is a WIP right now, but once it is ready for review

 > some of the nova helper and grafana client type stuff into separate
 > changes, and then have the new datasource code come last.

Yeah the nova changes have little correlation so the could move into a separate patch. I think it would be a bit silly to break up the Grafana configuration and the datasource itself into multiple patches as the configuration changes would not have any function without the datasource.

revisions:
[{'created': '2019-04-02 14:22:48.000000000', 'message': '[WIP] Grafana proxy datasource to retrieve metrics

New datasource to retrieve metrics that can be configured in a
flexible way depending on the deployment. Current implemenation only
works with influxdb. Slight changes to datasource manager were
necessary because grafana metric_map can only be built at runtime.

Change-Id: Ib12b6a7882703e84a27c301e821c1a034b192508
'}, {'created': '2019-04-03 07:52:26.000000000', 'message': '[WIP] Grafana proxy datasource to retrieve metrics

New datasource to retrieve metrics that can be configured in a
flexible way depending on the deployment. Current implemenation only
works with influxdb. Slight changes to datasource manager were
necessary because grafana metric_map can only be built at runtime.

Change-Id: Ib12b6a7882703e84a27c301e821c1a034b192508
'}, {'created': '2019-04-03 15:18:04.000000000', 'message': "[WIP] Grafana proxy datasource to retrieve metrics

New datasource to retrieve metrics that can be configured in a
flexible way depending on the deployment. Current implemenation only
works with influxdb. Slight changes to datasource manager were
necessary because grafana metric_map can only be built at runtime.

Specific databases accesible through grafana can be defined by
creating 'translators' for these specific databases. This patch
introduces a base class for these translators and their methods.

Change-Id: Ib12b6a7882703e84a27c301e821c1a034b192508
"}, {'created': '2019-04-04 13:57:02.000000000', 'message': "[WIP] Grafana proxy datasource to retrieve metrics

New datasource to retrieve metrics that can be configured in a
flexible way depending on the deployment. Current implemenation only
works with influxdb. Slight changes to datasource manager were
necessary because grafana metric_map can only be built at runtime.

Specific databases accesible through grafana can be defined by
creating 'translators' for these specific databases. This patch
introduces a base class for these translators and their methods.

Change-Id: Ib12b6a7882703e84a27c301e821c1a034b192508
"}, {'created': '2019-04-15 12:20:32.000000000', 'message': "[WIP] Grafana proxy datasource to retrieve metrics

New datasource to retrieve metrics that can be configured in a
flexible way depending on the deployment. Current implemenation only
works with influxdb. Slight changes to datasource manager were
necessary because grafana metric_map can only be built at runtime.

Specific databases accesible through grafana can be defined by
creating 'translators' for these specific databases. This patch
introduces a base class for these translators and their methods.

Change-Id: Ib12b6a7882703e84a27c301e821c1a034b192508
"}, {'created': '2019-04-17 09:13:28.000000000', 'message': "[WIP] Grafana proxy datasource to retrieve metrics

New datasource to retrieve metrics that can be configured in a
flexible way depending on the deployment. Current implemenation only
works with influxdb. Slight changes to datasource manager were
necessary because grafana metric_map can only be built at runtime.

Specific databases accesible through grafana can be defined by
creating 'translators' for these specific databases. This patch
introduces a base class for these translators and their methods.

Change-Id: Ib12b6a7882703e84a27c301e821c1a034b192508
"}, {'created': '2019-04-17 12:58:41.000000000', 'message': "[WIP] Grafana proxy datasource to retrieve metrics

New datasource to retrieve metrics that can be configured in a
flexible way depending on the deployment. Current implemenation only
works with influxdb. Slight changes to datasource manager were
necessary because grafana metric_map can only be built at runtime.

Specific databases accesible through grafana can be defined by
creating 'translators' for these specific databases. This patch
introduces a base class for these translators and their methods.

commit_message:
Grafana proxy datasource to retrieve metrics

New datasource to retrieve metrics that can be configured in a
flexible way depending on the deployment. Current implemenation only
works with InfluxDB. Slight changes to datasource manager were
necessary because grafana metric_map can only be built at runtime.

The yaml configuration file can still be used to define metrics
but will require that five different attributes are specified per
metric.

Specific databases accesible through grafana can be defined by
creating 'translators' for these specific databases. This patch
introduces a base class for these translators and their methods.

In addition the first translator specific for InfluxDB is
created.

Depends-on: I68475883529610e514aa82f1881105ab0cf24ec3
Depends-on: If1f27dc01e853c5b24bdb21f1e810f64eaee2e5c
Implements: blueprint grafana-proxy-datasource
Change-Id: Ib12b6a7882703e84a27c301e821c1a034b192508

commit_message:
remove baremetal nodes when building CDM

aggregate list and availability_zone list may return ironic type
compute nodes. When building compute data model we should check
the hypervisor_type and remove ironic compute nodes.

Change-Id: Idf404c104c30368baf95ef7d05ad8fc3e7adca38
Related-Bug: #1835183

commit_message:
Add get_node_by_name

We want to set the value of uuid field of Watcher ComputeNode
to hypversion id(as uuid). We need a method to get compute
node by name.

Change-Id: I0975500f359de92b6d6fdea2e01614cf0ba73f05
Related-Bug: #1835192

revisions:
[{'created': '2019-07-11 13:00:16.000000000', 'message': 'Resolve aggregate error in workload_stabilization

This error is caused because the condition "is not '':" is not always
true. Sometimes self.aggregation_method['node'] is u'' instead of ''.
This patch ensures that in both cases the behavior is the same.

Change-Id: I7453678cc76892ebeacca23c3501a10a08725d1d
Closes-bug: #1836195
'}]
commit_message:
Resolve aggregate error in workload_stabilization

This error is caused because the condition "is not '':" is not always
true. Sometimes self.aggregation_method['node'] is u'' instead of ''.
This patch ensures that in both cases the behavior is the same.

Change-Id: I7453678cc76892ebeacca23c3501a10a08725d1d
Closes-bug: #1836195

messages:
[{'account_id': 29299, 'date': '2019-05-10 18:58:43.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 10068, 'date': '2019-05-10 18:59:17.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

Thank you for your first contribution to OpenStack.

Your patch will now be tested automatically by OpenStack testing frameworks
and once the automatic tests pass, it will be reviewed by other friendly
developers. They will give you feedback and may require you to refine it.

People seldom get their patch approved on the first try, so don't be
concerned if requested to make corrections. Feel free to modify your patch
and resubmit a new change-set.

Patches usually take 3 to 7 days to be reviewed so be patient and be
available on IRC to ask and answer questions about your work. Also it
takes generally at least a couple of weeks for cores to get around to
reviewing code. The more you participate in the community the more
rewarding it is for you. You may also notice that the more you get to know
people and get to be known, the faster your patches will be reviewed and
eventually approved. Get to know others and become known by doing code
reviews: anybody can do it, and it's a great way to learn the code base.

Thanks again for supporting OpenStack, we look forward to working with you.

IRC: https://wiki.openstack.org/wiki/IRC
Workflow: https://docs.openstack.org/infra/manual/developers.html
Commit Messages: https://wiki.openstack.org/wiki/GitCommitMessages"}, {'account_id': 21224, 'date': '2019-05-21 06:00:37.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

Thanks for your contribution, genevieve nantel
This patch should be updated
1. Git log message format is not correct, you can refer to this link: https://wiki.openstack.org/wiki/GitCommitMessages
2. No unit tests were added
3. It's better to write a spec file to tell other devs better understand this patch (IMO, this is not a bug, but a new feature, so we should consider it as a blueprint)"}, {'account_id': 16006, 'date': '2019-05-21 15:50:09.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+1'}, {'account_id': 30047, 'date': '2019-06-05 14:53:00.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+1'}, {'account_id': 29299, 'date': '2019-06-12 18:56:31.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2.'}, {'account_id': 29299, 'date': '2019-06-12 20:28:14.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 3: Commit message was updated.'}, {'account_id': 29299, 'date': '2019-06-12 20:35:33.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 4: Commit message was updated.'}, {'account_id': 29299, 'date': '2019-06-14 21:47:34.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 5.'}, {'account_id': 16006, 'date': '2019-06-17 19:03:42.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 5: Code-Review+1'}, {'account_id': 26925, 'date': '2019-06-18 21:13:16.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 5: Code-Review+1'}, {'account_id': 21032, 'date': '2019-06-18 21:15:04.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 5: Code-Review+1'}, {'account_id': 28721, 'date': '2019-06-18 21:16:40.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 5: Code-Review+1'}, {'account_id': 30047, 'date': '2019-06-20 03:16:49.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 5: Code-Review+1'}, {'account_id': 21224, 'date': '2019-06-24 07:15:47.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 5:

commit_message:
Implements karbor events notifications

Getting the messages from Karbor like:
  - Plan create/update/delete
  - Checkpoint create/update/available
  - Restore create
  - Scheduled Operations create/delete
  - Triggers create/update/delete

This should add and send the desired messages to RabbitMQ with the
start and end identifiers for each message
(e.g. karbor.plan_create.start, karbor.plan_create.end). The
notification code was done in a similar fashion than the
notifications from the Trove project.

Implements:  blueprint karbor-event-notifications
Closes-Bug: 1797462
Change-Id: I0d7ffaa0873d192aeb24c17191683d705044644c

commit_message:
Support TLS deployments with KernelDisableIPv6 enabled

This will listen on 127.0.0.1 in case ipv6 is disabled.
The localhost_address is set in t-h-t kernel-baremetal-puppet.yaml
in a related patch.

Change-Id: Ic77281cc69230b77224421e3d79d93803ea18bad
Needed-By: Ide761c21dc87dadc722e27c9b8a7b68194164cb2
Related: rhbz#1703460
(cherry picked from commit 5061ed8b7b8419f1302d425e05b7f80f4d6d051b)

commit_message:
Add Python 3 Train unit tests

1. This is a mechanically generated patch to ensure unit testing is in place
for all of the Tested Runtimes for Train.
2. Remove a unnecessary space

See the Train python3-updates goal document for details:
https://governance.openstack.org/tc/goals/train/python3-updates.html

Change-Id: I89846e571cfabca4e6188be8a72337111bfa9bff

commit_message:
Make UpdateService.simple_update() operational

This change fixes a bug in `simple_update` implementation giving
HTTP POST method a chance to succeed.

Also, `UpdateService` action field refactored to better align with
the rest of sushy.

Change-Id: I3fdf58ec6c38282c67bd87729675636d8d90db1e
Story: 2003853
Task: 26652

commit_message:
Fix exposed UpdateService constants

Sushy library exposed a collection of constants to the user of the
library. These constants are frequently used in library calls to
achieve desired behaviour.

The exposed constants are strings, they are designed to be
human-friendly as opposed to tedious machine identifiers.

It seems that the way UpdateService resource is implemented turns
the general principle upside down. Meaning that the constants are
taken from JSON serialization. This patch flips these things over
retaining backward compatibility.

Change-Id: I0b46db187018350062aaa1cd815fa4e029df4d3e
Story: 2003853
Task: 26652

subject: Low case `ParamTypes` in received `MessageRegistry`
reviewers: [{'_account_id': 7160, 'name': 'arkady kanevsky', 'email': 'akanevsk@redhat.com', 'username': 'arkady'}, {'_account_id': 10250, 'name': 'Christopher Dearborn', 'email': 'Christopher.Dearborn@dell.com', 'username': 'cdearbor'}, {'_account_id': 10379, 'name': 'Rajini Karthik', 'email': 'rrajini@gmail.com', 'username': 'rajinir'}, {'_account_id': 11076, 'name': 'Shivanand Tendulker', 'email': 'stendulker@gmail.com', 'username': 'stendulker'}, {'_account_id': 22348, 'name': 'Zuul', 'username': 'zuul', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 23847, 'name': 'Richard G. Pioso', 'email': 'richard.pioso@dell.com', 'username': 'richard.pioso'}, {'_account_id': 23851, 'name': 'Riccardo Pittau', 'email': 'elfosardo@gmail.com', 'username': 'elfosardo'}, {'_account_id': 26340, 'name': 'Ilya Etingof', 'email': 'etingof@gmail.com', 'username': 'etingof'}, {'_account_id': 28128, 'name': 'Bill Dodd', 'email': 'billdodd@gmail.com', 'username': 'billdodd'}, {'_account_id': 28533, 'name': 'Mike Raineri', 'email': 'mraineri@gmail.com', 'username': 'mraineri'}]
messages:
[{'account_id': 26340, 'date': '2019-07-09 15:20:08.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 23847, 'date': '2019-07-09 15:51:54.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

Bill Dodd and Mike Raineri, your insights into what the Redfish specification has to say about this would be most welcome. Thank you!'}, {'account_id': 28128, 'date': '2019-07-09 16:34:38.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

CSDL:

      <EnumType Name="ParamType">
        <Member Name="string">
          <Annotation Term="OData.Description" String="The argument is a string."/>
        </Member>
        <Member Name="number">
          <Annotation Term="OData.Description" String="The argument is a number."/>
        </Member>
      </EnumType>

ParamType is an EnumType and EnumType is an OData entity. 

See the OData spec [1], section "10.3 Enumeration Type Member":

    "Enumeration type values consist of discrete members.

    Each member is identified by its name, a simple identifier that MUST be unique 
    within the enumeration type. Names are case-sensitive, but service authors 
    SHOULD NOT choose names that differ only in case."

So, per the spec, the names (e.g. "string" and "number") are case-sensitive.

[1] http://docs.oasis-open.org/odata/odata-csdl-xml/v4.01/cs01/odata-csdl-xml-v4.01-cs01.html'}, {'account_id': 10250, 'date': '2019-07-09 18:26:04.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+1'}, {'account_id': 26340, 'date': '2019-07-09 18:39:17.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

Thank you for the reviews!

[{'created': '2019-07-09 15:20:08.000000000', 'message': "Low case `ParamTypes` in received `MessageRegistry`

It turns out, that some implementations encountered in the wild waters
use different cases for (at least) `ParamTypes` enumerations in
`MessageRegistry` resource. In the schema [1] these enumerations
are all in low case.

To make sushy operational, this patch just ignores the case of
these enumerations. It's still an open question as to how strict the
case requirement is with Redfish (/cc Davy Jones).

1. https://redfish.dmtf.org/schemas/v1/MessageRegistry.v1_3_0.json

Change-Id: I107b689b8f4e27dd7331473124f7108d151cc55b
"}]
commit_message:
Low case `ParamTypes` in received `MessageRegistry`

It turns out, that some implementations encountered in the wild waters
use different cases for (at least) `ParamTypes` enumerations in
`MessageRegistry` resource. In the schema [1] these enumerations
are all in low case.

To make sushy operational, this patch just ignores the case of
these enumerations. It's still an open question as to how strict the
case requirement is with Redfish (/cc Davy Jones).

1. https://redfish.dmtf.org/schemas/v1/MessageRegistry.v1_3_0.json

Change-Id: I107b689b8f4e27dd7331473124f7108d151cc55b

commit_message:
Disregard registry files of unsupported types

This fix disregards `MessageRegistryFile` if it links anything other
than `MessageRegistry` resource. Apparently, it can also be
`AttributeRegistry` or `PrivilegeRegistry` or who knows what else
one could fish out of the depths of `MessageRegistryFile` [1].

1. http://redfish.dmtf.org/schemas/v1/MessageRegistryFile_v1.xml

Change-Id: Idfd2f1ed4ef78d048ac8bd5297619805db694bf6
Co-Authored-By: Richard G. Pioso <richard.pioso@dell.com>
Co-Authored-By: Mike Raineri <mraineri@gmail.com>

commit_message:
Handle incomplete message registries

This fix handles the case when the message registry does not contain
a language file neither for the requested language nor for the
default.

On top of that, this fix tries to use all potentially suitable
language files, not just the first one.

Change-Id: Ifdc3e444ba358604c248d9f0e1d5e59fd5e7b4cc
Co-Authored-By: Richard.Pioso@dell.com

revisions:
[{'created': '2019-07-10 14:34:50.000000000', 'message': 'Fix list security groups performance with RBAC

After change [1], if the system has a high number of security groups
with no associated RBAC entries, a non admin user owning only one
security group will experience unacceptable response times when
listing her security groups.

Change [1] added methods get_object and get_objects to class
RbacNeutronDbObjectMixin in neutron.objects.rbac_db, which retrieve with
and admin context all the objects (networks, subnets or security groups)
in the DB and then decide in memory whether the project that made the
query has access to them or not, based on their associated RBAC
policies. This change proposes to remove those methods and revert to
their counterparts in NeutronDbObject (neutron.objects.base), which use
a DB query scoped to the project to retrieve the objects based on their
associated RBAC policies by calling [2]. In this way, the potential
number of objects that are retrieved from the DB and that have to be
converted to OVOs is greatly reduced, improving significantly the
response time to the user.

[1] https://review.opendev.org/#/c/635311
[2] https://github.com/openstack/neutron-lib/blob/7a58374fde64fdc14e327940dde6bea4a8a39345/neutron_lib/db/model_query.py#L100

Change-Id: Idd303778d83089da8fbeff40e3dda2bd19008d8e
Closes-Bug: #1830679
(cherry picked from commit a240c68022d96c8639652cbdf57e707e68fb2a88)
'}]
commit_message:
Fix list security groups performance with RBAC

After change [1], if the system has a high number of security groups
with no associated RBAC entries, a non admin user owning only one
security group will experience unacceptable response times when
listing her security groups.

Change [1] added methods get_object and get_objects to class
RbacNeutronDbObjectMixin in neutron.objects.rbac_db, which retrieve with
and admin context all the objects (networks, subnets or security groups)
in the DB and then decide in memory whether the project that made the
query has access to them or not, based on their associated RBAC
policies. This change proposes to remove those methods and revert to
their counterparts in NeutronDbObject (neutron.objects.base), which use
a DB query scoped to the project to retrieve the objects based on their
associated RBAC policies by calling [2]. In this way, the potential
number of objects that are retrieved from the DB and that have to be
converted to OVOs is greatly reduced, improving significantly the
response time to the user.

[1] https://review.opendev.org/#/c/635311
[2] https://github.com/openstack/neutron-lib/blob/7a58374fde64fdc14e327940dde6bea4a8a39345/neutron_lib/db/model_query.py#L100

Change-Id: Idd303778d83089da8fbeff40e3dda2bd19008d8e
Closes-Bug: #1830679
(cherry picked from commit a240c68022d96c8639652cbdf57e707e68fb2a88)

'}, {'created': '2019-06-28 14:37:58.000000000', 'message': '[ NC Nova : Security Headers missing from error pages]

Change-Id: Ief137738f4b793f49f3632e25339c6f49492fd80
'}, {'created': '2019-07-01 14:28:21.000000000', 'message': 'Pentest - NC1.0 Nova Security HTTP Headers Not Present

The server should send an Content-Security-Policy: self  to make sure the browser does not allow any cross-site scripting attacks.
Additionally the server should send an X-Permitted-Cross-Domain-Policies:  none preveents webclients to handle data cross domains.
Change-Id: Ief137738f4b793f49f3632e25339c6f49492fd80
'}, {'created': '2019-07-01 20:44:17.000000000', 'message': 'Pentest - NC1.0 Nova Security HTTP Headers Not Present

Added new HTTP Security header Content-Security-Policy:self to
make sure the browser does not allow any cross-site scripting attacks.

Added new HTTPS Security header X-Permitted-Cross-Domain-Policies:none To
prevent web client to load data from the current domain

Change-Id: Ief137738f4b793f49f3632e25339c6f49492fd80
'}, {'created': '2019-07-01 20:47:44.000000000', 'message': 'Pentest - NC1.0 Nova Security HTTP Headers Not Present

Added new HTTP Security header Content-Security-Policy:self to
make sure the browser does not allow any cross-site scripting attacks.

Added new HTTPS Security header X-Permitted-Cross-Domain-Policies:none To

commit_message:
Pentest-NC1.0 NovaSecurity HTTP Headers Not Present

Added new HTTP Security header Content-Security-Policy:self to make
sure the browser does not allow any cross-site scripting attacks.

Added new HTTP Security header X-Permitted-Cross-Domain-Policies:none
To prevent web client to load data from the current domain.

Added new HTTP Security header X-XSS-Protection:1 mode=block to
sanitize the page, when a XSS attack is detected, the browser will
prevent rendering of the page.

Change-Id: Ief137738f4b793f49f3632e25339c6f49492fd80

messages:
[{'account_id': 11805, 'date': '2019-07-05 15:53:40.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 16643, 'date': '2019-07-08 23:43:02.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: Code-Review-1

We're only dropping py35, aren't we? So this change seems wrong."}, {'account_id': 11805, 'date': '2019-07-09 13:35:11.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

I know this is a very minor change. It's just attempting to keep this project in sync with the rest of the changes across openstack. The idea is that a default 'tox' run doesn't need to run both py36 and py37. Running just py37 will save developer time. The gate will then run py36 and py37. Note that envlist just covers what is run with a default 'tox' call. 'tox -e py36' could always be run as desired, for example even if py36 isn't ion the envlist."}, {'account_id': 29313, 'date': '2019-07-11 10:42:33.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review-1

Thanks, we might update this one to "py3" too, but teh number of devs complaining here is lesser :)'}]

commit_message:
Limit envlist to py37 for Python 3 Train goal

This is a mechanically generated patch to ensure unit testing is in place
for all of the Tested Runtimes for Train. The correct zuul jobs are
already in place so this change just limits default 'tox' calls to py37
to save developers time.

See the Train python3-updates goal document for details:
https://governance.openstack.org/tc/goals/train/python3-updates.html

Change-Id: I12f0713448677e5bedcbcbef36b73ee21f085331
Story: #2005924
Task: #34220

revisions:
[{'created': '2019-07-11 15:56:37.000000000', 'message': 'Add a per-request global_request_id

Adapter.__init__ takes a global_request_id which causes the
X-Openstack-Request-Id header to be set on each request. This is fine if
the Adapter is used for only one "request" (in the sense of e.g. "a
server create" -- see [1]), but is too broad if the Adapter is reused
for multiple requests. For example, Nova's SchedulerReportClient (used
to communicate with Placement) creates a single instance of Adapter for
the life of the process [2][3][4]. Openstack SDK's Proxy objects [5]
endure for the life of a Connection.

So what is needed is a way to manage the X-Openstack-Request-Id header
on a per-request basis.

This commit adds a global_request_id kwarg to
keystoneauth1.session.Session.request, which is the funnel point for all
requests coming through Adapter as well as Session itself. (All the
methods feeding into that one already accept and pass through arbitrary
**kwargs.) If present, the value in the X-Openstack-Request-Id header is
set accordingly. Note that this will *override*
Adapter.global_request_id, which is exactly what we want, as described
above.

[1] http://specs.openstack.org/openstack/oslo-specs/specs/pike/global-req-id.html
[2] https://opendev.org/openstack/nova/src/commit/bea9058f02927a3afd453af0532d21e2638d24db/nova/scheduler/client/report.py#L200
[3] https://opendev.org/openstack/nova/src/commit/bea9058f02927a3afd453af0532d21e2638d24db/nova/scheduler/client/report.py#L243
[4] https://opendev.org/openstack/nova/src/commit/bea9058f02927a3afd453af0532d21e2638d24db/nova/utils.py#L1219-L1221
[5] https://opendev.org/openstack/openstacksdk/src/commit/bf6651f149df8e607a9152c5eeb279164b3a7f8e/openstack/proxy.py#L114

Change-Id: Ied73320fcd813ae796e40cbdb30717900486b92c
'}]
commit_message:
Add a per-request global_request_id

Adapter.__init__ takes a global_request_id which causes the
X-Openstack-Request-Id header to be set on each request. This is fine if
the Adapter is used for only one "request" (in the sense of e.g. "a
server create" -- see [1]), but is too broad if the Adapter is reused
for multiple requests. For example, Nova's SchedulerReportClient (used
to communicate with Placement) creates a single instance of Adapter for
the life of the process [2][3][4]. Openstack SDK's Proxy objects [5]
endure for the life of a Connection.

So what is needed is a way to manage the X-Openstack-Request-Id header
on a per-request basis.

This commit adds a global_request_id kwarg to
keystoneauth1.session.Session.request, which is the funnel point for all
requests coming through Adapter as well as Session itself. (All the
methods feeding into that one already accept and pass through arbitrary
**kwargs.) If present, the value in the X-Openstack-Request-Id header is
set accordingly. Note that this will *override*
Adapter.global_request_id, which is exactly what we want, as described
above.

[1] http://specs.openstack.org/openstack/oslo-specs/specs/pike/global-req-id.html
[2] https://opendev.org/openstack/nova/src/commit/bea9058f02927a3afd453af0532d21e2638d24db/nova/scheduler/client/report.py#L200
[3] https://opendev.org/openstack/nova/src/commit/bea9058f02927a3afd453af0532d21e2638d24db/nova/scheduler/client/report.py#L243
[4] https://opendev.org/openstack/nova/src/commit/bea9058f02927a3afd453af0532d21e2638d24db/nova/utils.py#L1219-L1221
[5] https://opendev.org/openstack/openstacksdk/src/commit/bf6651f149df8e607a9152c5eeb279164b3a7f8e/openstack/proxy.py#L114

Change-Id: Ied73320fcd813ae796e40cbdb30717900486b92c

commit_message:
Makes molecule job parametrizable for rhel8 testing

As RHEL8 can be tested only on rdo, we do make the platform overridable,
so we can run rdo-tox-molecule* jobs to increase coverage.

Depends-On:  https://review.rdoproject.org/r/21435
Change-Id: I7fe594fceedaedd555a3bd34f7f9537d10908998

commit_message:
Set proper mysql python module depending on version

Galera Server fails during user creation on Ubuntu 16.04
and 18.04 as it's unable to find the proper mysql
module.

https://bugs.launchpad.net/openstack-ansible/+bug/1824987

This determines and sets the proper version to use.

Change-Id: Ibd4514306026648c509107904c82ce6afd76243f

commit_message:
Include nodesets in zuul/nodepool

We're sharing jobs from the zuul/nodepool repos with the openstack
tenant, so we also need to include nodeset objects which may be
referenced by those jobs.

Change-Id: If468622d21407858c6d2a8b24037501b0ca5fc48

commit_message:
Move zuul/zuul-base-jobs to a config-project

Base jobs (which this repo is full of) must be in a config project.

That's not ideal for how we'd like to test them, but we'll have to
solve that later.

Change-Id: I83313bf8b7e874e5527ea7f40d92db1de62ac672

[{'created': '2019-07-02 19:38:22.000000000', 'message': "Tweek the role-addition tox job

docker and run a molecule test, however, due to the fact we're
transitioning away from tox jobs that can modify the underlying
systemi, the tox environment has been tweeked so that it no longers
makes the assumption docker will be installed via tox. The job will
now check for a valid connection to docker or podman before attempting
to run a molecule test against the psuedo role. In the Zuul enviroment
docker will be present when the resource is provisioned. In a local
test environment, a valid container runtime will need to be deployed,
as documented in the contributing guide.

Change-Id: I277edc265e7cd885af55bbf64bbc5e4fda058950
Signed-off-by: Kevin Carter <kecarter@redhat.com>

commit_message:
Tweak the role-addition tox job

The role-addition tox job used to make the assumption it would install
docker and run a molecule test, however, due to the fact we're
transitioning away from tox jobs that can modify the underlying
system, the tox environment has been tweaked so that it no longers
makes the assumption docker will be installed via tox.

The tox job will now check for a valid connection to docker or podman
before attempting to run a molecule test against the pseudo role. In
the Zuul environment docker will be present when the resource is
provisioned via the tox-molecule job parent. In a local test
environments, a valid container runtime will need to be deployed,
which documented in the contributing guide. If the role-addition
tox environment is not able to connect to docker or podman a notice
will be displayed linking to the contributing documentation.

The job definition has been updated to ensure it runs anytime the
tox.ini file is changed. This was done because the tox.ini file
is the only mode of execution for this job.

Change-Id: I277edc265e7cd885af55bbf64bbc5e4fda058950
Signed-off-by: Kevin Carter <kecarter@redhat.com>

commit_message:
Temporarily shadow base-jobs in openstack-zuul-jobs

So that we can move the nodeset definitions to opende/base-jobs,
have openstack-zuul-jobs shadow that repo.

Change-Id: Ic3ea053093484fe6796f41a2d436bab6f79c8929

[{'created': '2019-07-10 15:25:03.000000000', 'message': 'Add release note ignore for backport note

This adds a directive to ignore a release note that we only want to show
up in a stable branch.

It also cleans up a previous instance of this where we needed to have
the ignore follow the release after stable branch creation.

Change-Id: I484bcb8aaa78548ddf2ef9063f689d533b1c692c
Signed-off-by: Sean McGinnis <sean.mcginnis@gmail.com>
'}, {'created': '2019-07-10 15:55:59.000000000', 'message': 'Add release note ignore for backport note

This adds a directive to ignore a release note that we only want to show
up in a stable branch.

It also cleans up a previous instance of this where we needed to have
the ignore follow the release after stable branch creation.

Change-Id: I484bcb8aaa78548ddf2ef9063f689d533b1c692c
Signed-off-by: Sean McGinnis <sean.mcginnis@gmail.com>
'}]
commit_message:
Add release note ignore for backport note

This adds a directive to ignore a release note that we only want to show
up in a stable branch.

It also cleans up a previous instance of this where we needed to have
the ignore follow the release after stable branch creation.

Change-Id: I484bcb8aaa78548ddf2ef9063f689d533b1c692c
Signed-off-by: Sean McGinnis <sean.mcginnis@gmail.com>

commit_message:
Armada: Fix issues with armada-lma manifest

This addresses issues with the armada-lma manifest that arose
after the splitting of the fluentbit and fluentd charts. The top
level labels key was missing from the fluentbit chart and the
logging chart group still referenced a nonexistent fluent-logging
chart

Change-Id: I5244fc9d065806c376ca5d18b6ced9ed445057c9
Signed-off-by: Steve Wilkerson <sw5822@att.com>

commit_message:
Disable systemd-resolved service in nameserver role

This updates the task in the disable-local-nameserver role to
include disabling the systemd-resolved service, as this causes
the entries we update in /etc/resolv.conf to not be honored as
systemd-resolved will use a different set of files for configuring
the nameservers it uses.

See: https://www.freedesktop.org/software/systemd/man/systemd-resolved.service.html

Change-Id: I68a623b7bcb32037b9eeff2d76c7f2cb317cb7d8
Signed-off-by: Steve Wilkerson <sw5822@att.com>

commit_message:
Enable calico prometheus metrics for minikube

This updates the minikube deployment script to patch the
calico-node daemonset to set the appropriate annotations and
environment variables required for felix to expose prometheus
metrics

Change-Id: Ic5dc2ecb298add12cd3b150cc4d26e7639c43488
Signed-off-by: Steve Wilkerson <sw5822@att.com>

subject: trivial change to test my gerrit account
messages:
[{'account_id': 30670, 'date': '2019-07-10 14:36:34.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 10068, 'date': '2019-07-10 14:36:47.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

Thank you for your first contribution to OpenStack.

Your patch will now be tested automatically by OpenStack testing frameworks
and once the automatic tests pass, it will be reviewed by other friendly
developers. They will give you feedback and may require you to refine it.

People seldom get their patch approved on the first try, so don't be
concerned if requested to make corrections. Feel free to modify your patch
and resubmit a new change-set.

Patches usually take 3 to 7 days to be reviewed so be patient and be
available on IRC to ask and answer questions about your work. Also it
takes generally at least a couple of weeks for cores to get around to
reviewing code. The more you participate in the community the more
rewarding it is for you. You may also notice that the more you get to know
people and get to be known, the faster your patches will be reviewed and
eventually approved. Get to know others and become known by doing code
reviews: anybody can do it, and it's a great way to learn the code base.

Thanks again for supporting OpenStack, we look forward to working with you.

IRC: https://wiki.openstack.org/wiki/IRC
Workflow: https://docs.openstack.org/infra/manual/developers.html
Commit Messages: https://wiki.openstack.org/wiki/GitCommitMessages"}, {'account_id': 30670, 'date': '2019-07-11 19:03:42.000000000', 'content': 'Abandoned

It was only a test to verify my account. No need to merge.'}]

Update auth_url in install docs

Beginning with the Queens release, the keystone install guide
recommends running all interfaces on the same port.This patch
updates the swift install guide to reflect that change

Change-Id: Id00cfd2c921da352abdbbbb6668b921f3cb31a1a
Closes-bug: #1754104

commit_message:
Add logging of servers console in scenario test_port_forwardings

In case when ssh to one of servers in test test_port_forwardings
will fail it is useful to have consile log from servers used in
test.
This patch adds logging of such console output in this test.

Change-Id: I597d2c13544d668f88d78016ff4545e164e97a3e

revisions:
[{'created': '2019-07-11 08:04:25.000000000', 'message': 'Make the keycloak middleware thread safe

After moving to uWSGI keycloak middleware was found to be not
thread safe since we hold the token nad relam in an attribute
of a class which initialized once.
So if there are several threads
accessing the class there might have race conditions
lets move them to be parameters on the stack

Change-Id: I5325c7f08f6567d46189d4efdfbc9b0f6f5a8916
'}]
commit_message:
Make the keycloak middleware thread safe

After moving to uWSGI keycloak middleware was found to be not
thread safe since we hold the token nad relam in an attribute
of a class which initialized once.
So if there are several threads
accessing the class there might have race conditions
lets move them to be parameters on the stack

Change-Id: I5325c7f08f6567d46189d4efdfbc9b0f6f5a8916

commit_message:
Remove service specific periodic jobs that add no value

This removes the service specific job definitions that currently
run periodically, as they add no value (as they're currently part
of the compute kit jobs).  This helps ensure we have a workable
history of our multinode periodic jobs, as the current number of
periodic jobs limits us to ~2 days of history with no added value

Change-Id: Id525ca4895de2673bed2b638b816834bcf34e131
Signed-off-by: Steve Wilkerson <sw5822@att.com>

commit_message:
Add host and hypervisor_hostname flag to create server

Add a new microversion that adds two new params to create
server named 'host' and 'hypervisor_hostname'.

Part of Blueprint: add-host-and-hypervisor-hostname-flag-to-create-server

Change-Id: I3afea20edaf738da253ede44b4a07414ededafd6

subject: tests: Avoid using mock wraps
messages:
[{'account_id': 15334, 'date': '2019-06-06 13:21:56.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 15334, 'date': '2019-06-06 13:23:38.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2: Commit message was updated.'}, {'account_id': 10234, 'date': '2019-06-06 13:43:29.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2: Code-Review-1

it's not good to just remove tests..."}, {'account_id': 15334, 'date': '2019-06-06 14:06:31.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2:

> it's not good to just remove tests...

I gave my rationale for doing so in the commit message though:

 > ...but the fact is these tests were extremely tightly coupled to the implementation and probably didn't need to be

I'm not sure why it's important to inspect the exact order that things are called in. You're testing the exact implementation as opposed to the end result, which seems wrong."}, {'account_id': 15334, 'date': '2019-06-06 14:07:48.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2:

Also note that I'm not removing tests because ec2-api functionality is broken. I'm removing them because mock has changed it behavior. I don't feel we're losing important test coverage here."}, {'account_id': 15334, 'date': '2019-06-13 15:57:38.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2:

@Andrey Pavlov: Any updates here? I won't be able to work through fixing these tests any other way so this is as good as I can do. If you or someone else wants to take over this, please feel free. If not, I might abandon to clean up my review queue."}, {'account_id': 10234, 'date': '2019-06-17 18:22:17.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: -Code-Review'}, {'account_id': 10234, 'date': '2019-06-17 18:23:51.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2: Code-Review+2 Workflow+1

revisions:
[{'created': '2019-06-06 13:21:56.000000000', 'message': "tests: Avoid using mock wraps

It looks like something has changed in mock 3.x, resulting in some
functions that are wrapped by mock not being called or being called
incorrectly. This breaks some of the assertions we have. There is almost
certainly a bug (or is it a feature, who knows) but the fact is these
tests were extremely tightly coupled to the implementation and probably
didn't need to be. Stop attempting to spy on them and resolve the issue.

We also start using 'assert_not_called' since that's available in mock
3.x.

Change-Id: I06dddc4eba36f80398732ab4f2b7cbc4d7717a00
Signed-off-by: Stephen Finucane <stephenfin@redhat.com>
"}, {'created': '2019-06-06 13:23:38.000000000', 'message': "tests: Avoid using mock wraps

It looks like something has changed in mock 3.x, resulting in some
functions that are wrapped by mock not being called or being called
incorrectly. This breaks some of the assertions we have. There is almost
certainly a bug (or is it a feature, who knows) but the fact is these
tests were extremely tightly coupled to the implementation and probably
didn't need to be. Stop attempting to spy on them and resolve the issue.

We also start using 'assert_not_called' since that's available in mock
3.x.

Change-Id: I06dddc4eba36f80398732ab4f2b7cbc4d7717a00
Signed-off-by: Stephen Finucane <stephenfin@redhat.com>
Closes-Bug: #1831870
"}]
commit_message:
tests: Avoid using mock wraps

It looks like something has changed in mock 3.x, resulting in some
functions that are wrapped by mock not being called or being called
incorrectly. This breaks some of the assertions we have. There is almost
certainly a bug (or is it a feature, who knows) but the fact is these
tests were extremely tightly coupled to the implementation and probably
didn't need to be. Stop attempting to spy on them and resolve the issue.

We also start using 'assert_not_called' since that's available in mock
3.x.

Change-Id: I06dddc4eba36f80398732ab4f2b7cbc4d7717a00
Signed-off-by: Stephen Finucane <stephenfin@redhat.com>
Closes-Bug: #1831870

revisions:
[{'created': '2019-07-11 16:38:09.000000000', 'message': 'Dont set constraints on sphinx

This python package does not need a constraint. In this case the
constraint is being removed because it will break on py27 which
we have to still support until 1 January 2019. Modern sphinx
will automatically limit the version installed based on the
detected version of python.

Change-Id: I5091a6c30eec43ec24e3664813bc1fafd89f3e28
Signed-off-by: Kevin Carter <kecarter@redhat.com>
'}]
commit_message:
Dont set constraints on sphinx

This python package does not need a constraint. In this case the
constraint is being removed because it will break on py27 which
we have to still support until 1 January 2019. Modern sphinx
will automatically limit the version installed based on the
detected version of python.

Change-Id: I5091a6c30eec43ec24e3664813bc1fafd89f3e28
Signed-off-by: Kevin Carter <kecarter@redhat.com>

subject: Fix docs Zuul jobs
messages: [{'account_id': 6547, 'date': '2019-07-11 16:23:15.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 7353, 'date': '2019-07-11 16:26:39.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+1'}, {'account_id': 14985, 'date': '2019-07-11 16:59:32.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2'}, {'account_id': 3153, 'date': '2019-07-11 17:53:27.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Workflow+1'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2019-07-11 16:23:15.000000000', 'message': 'Fix docs Zuul jobs

The project uses a variant of build-openstack-tox-docs for building
documentation, the publishing job for this is
publish-openstack-tox-docs. Use this publishing job in post queue
instead of the obsolete publish-openstack-sphinx-docs which fails in
this repo since it does not match the build job.

Also, use the release-notes-jobs-python3 instead of adding individual jobs,
this allows updating in a central place. The template does exactly the
same what the jobs do.

Change-Id: I107009c361b594c2493b09fec4e5bc687f103171
'}]
commit_message:
Fix docs Zuul jobs

The project uses a variant of build-openstack-tox-docs for building
documentation, the publishing job for this is
publish-openstack-tox-docs. Use this publishing job in post queue
instead of the obsolete publish-openstack-sphinx-docs which fails in
this repo since it does not match the build job.

Also, use the release-notes-jobs-python3 instead of adding individual jobs,
this allows updating in a central place. The template does exactly the
same what the jobs do.

Change-Id: I107009c361b594c2493b09fec4e5bc687f103171

commit_message:

commit_message:
Ceph: Break out RadosGW into seperate chart

This PS breaks out RadosGW into its own chart, allowing a single
deployment to both deploy the radosgw itself, and also maange
keystone users for use with the swift API.

commit_message:
Nova: Move all config to be directly values driven.

This PS moves all the config files to be directly values driven,
both simplifying over-ride and allowing configs to be targeted
to pods in future work.

(2 comments)

Corey I know that this is a lot of churn for a mechanically generated patch.  If we had known that the cross-project goal was to be implemented by mechanically generated patches then perhaps we wouldn't have made the effort to meet that goal in the first place with hand-written patches and had reviewers discuss the right way to do it in our project, etc.  The conflicts here are between implementation details that conflict between the mechanical patch and the patches generated by humans in review, both of which achieved the cross-project goal."}, {'account_id': 21884, 'date': '2019-07-10 17:52:31.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2:

commit_message:
Add Python 3 Train unit tests

This is a mechanically generated patch to ensure unit testing is in place
for all of the Tested Runtimes for Train.

See the Train python3-updates goal document for details:
https://governance.openstack.org/tc/goals/train/python3-updates.html

Change-Id: Ibf4e7a4075f7375138a59462cab132f64d874dbc
Story: #2005924
Task: #34220

subject: Manila support in python-openstackclient

(55 comments)

Thanks a lot for getting this started Vicky... just did a preliminary pass over this spec, and noted concerns..'}, {'account_id': 20813, 'date': '2019-03-19 16:36:33.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 3.'}, {'account_id': 20813, 'date': '2019-03-19 16:36:55.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: Code-Review-1

WIP'}, {'account_id': 20813, 'date': '2019-03-20 17:54:59.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 4.'}, {'account_id': 20813, 'date': '2019-03-20 17:58:12.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4:

@Goutham, I talked with cinder people and they don't plan to implement adopt/abandon any time soon. However, OpenStack CLI uses "set" to manage snapshots and "unset" for unmanage[1]. Should we do the same? 

[1] https://docs.openstack.org/cinder/latest/cli/cli-manage-volumes.html#manage-a-snapshot'}, {'account_id': 16643, 'date': '2019-03-21 00:22:34.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4:

> @Goutham, I talked with cinder people and they don't plan to implement adopt/abandon any time soon. However, OpenStack CLI uses "set" to manage snapshots and "unset" for unmanage[1]. Should we do the same? 



Hi Sofia, the cinder implementation, i.e, "set/unset" sounds very weird to me... because you're not setting properties/metadata on existing snapshot resources; these are snapshots cinder doesn't know about... The code doesn't seem to match the documentation as well... see https://opendev.org/openstack/python-openstackclient/src/commit/6bd9cb6359bbe1b535876025244fb5e6df652345/openstackclient/volume/v2/snapshot.py#L213, that controller does not "manage" or unmanage snapshots...'}, {'account_id': 16643, 'date': '2019-05-08 17:46:31.000000000', 'content': 'Topic set to bp/openstack-client-support'}, {'account_id': 20813, 'date': '2019-05-31 14:52:14.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 5.'}, {'account_id': 18058, 'date': '2019-05-31 17:46:25.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 5: Code-Review-1

(2 comments)

Please check a couple of comments inline.'}, {'account_id': 20813, 'date': '2019-05-31 18:41:00.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 6.'}, {'account_id': 18058, 'date': '2019-06-12 17:39:02.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 6: Code-Review-1

(1 comment)

Please add an empty line between '::' and the code snippet, otherwise it won't be rendered properly[0].

[0] http://logs.openstack.org/18/644218/6/check/openstack-tox-docs/eac10de/html/specs/train/manila-support-openstackclient.html"}, {'account_id': 29958, 'date': '2019-06-13 15:16:07.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 7.'}, {'account_id': 18058, 'date': '2019-06-13 15:38:03.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 7:

(2 comments)'}, {'account_id': 29958, 'date': '2019-06-14 16:21:35.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 8.'}, {'account_id': 18058, 'date': '2019-06-18 00:16:00.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 8:

(9 comments)

There are some more command arguments that are kebab-case instead of separated by a space.
Not sure if we need to be so precise in this document though. As you already wrote,
> This spec is not intended to be a full and correct specification of command and argument names.'}, {'account_id': 29958, 'date': '2019-06-19 14:07:49.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 9.'}, {'account_id': 18058, 'date': '2019-06-19 14:34:09.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 9: Code-Review-1

So you're going to dehyphenate everything? Then please replace all occurrences of: snapshot-instance, export-location, security-service and get-progress."}, {'account_id': 29958, 'date': '2019-06-21 20:33:27.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 9: Code-Review-1

(1 comment)

Lucio: sorry, I was following the guidance of my mentor. I think it's better to leave the discussion for the next manila meeting."}, {'account_id': 16643, 'date': '2019-06-24 23:23:50.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 9: Code-Review-1

(25 comments)

commit_message:
Manila support in python-openstackclient

python-openstackclient is the default command line client
for many OpenStack projects. Having support for python-openstackclient
is a community goal for the Train cycle and it's important that we do
this so we are consistent with the rest of the projects in the OpenStack
ecosystem.

Present a convenient mapping between the current python-manilaclient
and the future implementation for the manila support in python-openstackclient
aiming for ease of use.

Change-Id: I051bedac0f0eb6064bb72efc155ecdf0e6814a75
Co-Authored-By: Sofia Enriquez <lsofia.enriquez@gmail.com>

All the Ansible variables in the validations playbooks must be at the
same level as the metadata and not part of them.

```
- hosts: myhost
  vars:

      name: Validation name
      description: What should this validation do...
      groups:

        - pre-deployment
    variable1: "value1"
    variable2: "value2"
    ...
```

commit_message:
Get all the available Ansible variables for each validations

All the Ansible variables in the validations playbooks must be at the
same level as the metadata and not part of them.

```
- hosts: myhost
  vars:
    metadata:
      name: Validation name
      description: What should this validation do...
      groups:
        - prep
        - pre-deployment
    variable1: "value1"
    variable2: "value2"
    ...
```

Change-Id: Ib3d9ea8d9f85ea194a16feacb530d50419d7e54a
Signed-off-by: Gael Chamoulaud <gchamoul@redhat.com>

commit_message:
Allow logrotate to access container_file_t files

Since we write logs directly from within containers, logrotate must be
able to access them.

Change-Id: I2a06cdcda92b2839d74373d6978ef65e7b4dedbd
Related-Bug: #1836000
(cherry picked from commit b81bec56f27f08cc4a6f81416aad422a15bd3ce7)

- nova-dsvm-full-tempest http://cloudbase-ci.com/nova/535510/5/ : SUCCESS in 2h 54m 43s'}, {'account_id': 21813, 'date': '2018-05-25 10:01:39.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 5: Code-Review-1

(4 comments)

Thanks!

In my humble opinion if we have possibility to make adding/removing security call deprecated let's do that rather than adding new complexity.

Maybe adding a new microversion is an option? We can leave solving this bug up to neutron client."}, {'account_id': 25562, 'date': '2018-05-30 14:51:32.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 5: Code-Review-1

(1 comment)

I have tested the code with concurrent API calls in my Queens environment a few times. Both security groups got updated properly. Generally good efforts with a couple of concerns (see inline).'}, {'account_id': 27654, 'date': '2018-09-21 19:26:07.000000000', 'content': "Abandoned

According to @Andrey Volkov's comment, the API for adding/removing security is deprecated so my default position is not to proceed with this effort which might add additional complexity of the deprecated API, unless nova team still wants the fix.."}, {'account_id': 6873, 'date': '2019-07-11 16:53:22.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 5:

> the API for adding/removing security is deprecated

That's not true. add/removeSecurityGroup APIs are not deprecated. The non-server resource related security group APIs were deprecated in newton:

https://specs.openstack.org/openstack/nova-specs/specs/newton/implemented/deprecate-api-proxies.html

And confusingly some other network related proxy APIs were deprecated in Pike like add/removeFloatingIP:

https://specs.openstack.org/openstack/nova-specs/specs/pike/implemented/deprecate-multinic-proxy-api.html

But add/removeSecurityGroup APIs are not officially deprecated."}]

commit_message:
Use revision_number on adding/removing security group

If there are concurrent API calls to add/remove security group.
Race condition might occur. This patch prevents the race condition
by using the revision number of security group for conditionally
update.

Change-Id: I0651417d18ee54e5c8b5b7292c27159b45e9acf3
Closes-Bug: #1417975

subject: Implement mandatory flag for RabbitMQ driver
messages:
[{'account_id': 29364, 'date': '2019-06-27 11:18:12.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 28522, 'date': '2019-06-27 17:05:47.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review-1

(1 comment)'}, {'account_id': 28522, 'date': '2019-06-27 17:29:37.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

Weird...
http://logs.openstack.org/02/667902/1/check/openstack-tox-lower-constraints/234e8ae/job-output.txt.gz#_2019-06-27_11_28_16_527807

We use kombu==4.6.3 (https://github.com/celery/kombu/tree/568dcd4189d5ceeeb5bcd7bea05dcfc9a98846b5)

Everything seem good in your implementation... you define the on_return on producer init [1] and when we will pass mandatory through transport_options when we will publish [2] so on_return will be called if something went wrong.

I guess we need to adapt some tests [3] to avoid this `revive` [4] issue.

[1] https://kombu.readthedocs.io/en/1.0/reference/kombu.messaging.html
[2] https://kombu.readthedocs.io/en/1.0/reference/kombu.messaging.html#kombu.messaging.Producer.publish
[3] https://github.com/openstack/oslo.messaging/blob/6cdd4cb00779acd5b5825b5f00635af08f92a5df/oslo_messaging/tests/drivers/test_impl_rabbit.py#L108
[4] https://github.com/celery/kombu/blob/568dcd4189d5ceeeb5bcd7bea05dcfc9a98846b5/kombu/messaging.py#L232'}, {'account_id': 29364, 'date': '2019-06-28 17:42:54.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2.'}, {'account_id': 29364, 'date': '2019-06-28 17:54:19.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 3.'}, {'account_id': 29364, 'date': '2019-06-28 17:57:14.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3:

@Herv you are right. 
The error you see on the test is this [1] that I fixed here [2]
so we need Kombu 4.6.1.

1-https://github.com/celery/kombu/issues/1050
2-https://github.com/celery/kombu/pull/1053'}, {'account_id': 29364, 'date': '2019-06-29 05:44:17.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3:

recheck'}, {'account_id': 8770, 'date': '2019-07-01 15:05:05.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: Code-Review-1

(1 comment)'}, {'account_id': 29364, 'date': '2019-07-01 19:39:13.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 4.'}, {'account_id': 28522, 'date': '2019-07-02 09:01:11.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4: Code-Review+1

Thanks.
Just a +1 for now, I need to play with your github tests before sending my +2.'}, {'account_id': 28522, 'date': '2019-07-03 16:48:21.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4: Code-Review+2

Tested successfully with https://github.com/Gsantomaggio/rabbitmq-utils/tree/master/openstack/mandatory_test!

Really good job!

Thanks for all your contribs!'}, {'account_id': 8770, 'date': '2019-07-11 14:33:41.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4: Code-Review+2 Workflow+1

Nice!'}, {'account_id': 6928, 'date': '2019-07-11 15:16:02.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 4:

Nice, do we have docs to point people at to explain how to use this?

Also, have we considered best practices for enabling this feature? If it only works for rabbit, can consumers write their software assuming this feature? If they do, they'll essentially lose support for the other messaging backends, right?"}, {'account_id': 29364, 'date': '2019-07-11 15:32:52.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 4:

> Nice, do we have docs to point people at to explain how to use this?
Thank you.
Currently, there is this [1] on my repository. The idea is to move it somewhere else inside OpenStack. 

> Also, have we considered the best practices for enabling this feature? 
I will add a section inside the documentation about that. At the moment here [1]. I think that client side it should be enabled by default. 

> If it only works for rabbit, can consumers write their software assuming this feature? 
Yes, at the moment it works only in RabbitMQ.  

> If they do, they'll essentially lose support for the other messaging backends, right?
The idea is that eventually, each driver will implement this feature. 
But no, they won't lose the support of the other backends, at the moment the feature does not work. But the feature does not impact the other backends. 


1 - https://github.com/Gsantomaggio/rabbitmq-utils/tree/master/openstack/mandatory_test"}]

commit_message:
Implement mandatory flag for RabbitMQ driver

With this feature it is possible to use the mandatory RabbitMQ
mandatory flag.

Implements: blueprint transport-options (point 3)

The blueprint link is [1]

Please follow the link [2] to use and test the feature.

1- https://blueprints.launchpad.net/oslo.messaging/+spec/transport-options
2- https://github.com/Gsantomaggio/rabbitmq-utils/
tree/master/openstack/mandatory_test

Change-Id: Ie269fc08ba80c4b94a24a8207c1e86c19c3b3fcb

commit_message:
Migrate to opendev infra

- Adds `.gitreview` to allow `git review` usage
- Adds `.zuul.yaml` for initial jobs to run on CI
- Changes `setup.py` to follow the OpenStack format
- Adds `setup.cfg` with the information that was
in the old `setup.py`
- Removes `verify_installation.py`
- Updates `README` with newer information
- Removes uWSGI from requirements.txt

Change-Id: Id247c4eebf9dec94556b500866a360d6c24b9a92

commit_message:
Convert heat template to use aide role

This change converts the aide heat tempalate to using the aide role
from tripleo-ansible.

Depends-On: I3a34152dd0cd7363a6f138d6e1c6fd0f062a3ac6
Change-Id: I20b5e91c2d5f03b5cfd78b5568ee9b0d8c1f6157
Signed-off-by: Kevin Carter <kecarter@redhat.com>

commit_message:
Remove tripleo-common/playbooks

These playbooks have been imported into tripleo-ansible where they will
be maintained from now on. This change removes the old playbooks directory,
cleans-up its entry in setup.cfg and updates the relevant workbooks to
ensure they're pointing at the proper location.

Depends-On: Ib9be1d4910872fa38bc52fa2327bfdff37c03d06
Change-Id: I81861520972fc7ffcc8620388eb1f8288405f75a
Signed-off-by: Kevin Carter <kecarter@redhat.com>

commit_message:
Add Python 3 Train unit tests

This is a mechanically generated patch to ensure unit testing is in place
for all of the Tested Runtimes for Train.

See the Train python3-updates goal document for details:
https://governance.openstack.org/tc/goals/train/python3-updates.html

Change-Id: If60d2d3d3fc0cc55cf44d483ac13fdc38c9322ae
Story: #2005924
Task: #34244

commit_message:
Add molecule testing

This change adds molecule testing using a simple base job and pre|run playbooks.
The test will be executed via a native zuul job and will ensure we're exercising
all of the available code path's as provide by this role.

Two molecule scenarios will be executed whenever any change is made to this role

* default - runs through the typical main code path
* login - tests a secure docker registry ensuring our login capabilities are
          never broken.

Documentation in the readme has been added to show how local testing can be run.

A bindep.txt file has been added to ensure zuul knows how to install our
required base packages.

Closes-Bug: #1835657
Related-Bug: #1833584
Change-Id: I48f74b69c5d29dce4a576fa96e79563a4b484469
Signed-off-by: Kevin Carter <kecarter@redhat.com>

commit_message:
Remove pre_deploy/rhel-registration

The rhel-registration scripts support has been removed. It was replaced in
Rocky by the Ansible RHSM role. Upgrades have been tested and the new
configuration is well documented.

https://docs.openstack.org/tripleo-docs/latest/install/advanced_deployment/rhsm.html

Change-Id: I596028eae8174fa86d7a721b8688c57c69d3d62c

revisions:
[{'created': '2019-07-02 00:58:42.000000000', 'message': "FC: Ignore some HBAs from map for single WWNN

Current FC OS-Brick code only checks for single WWNN to exclude some
HBAs from scanning when we don't receive an initiator_target_map from
the backend.

There are storage arrays,like XtremIO, that due to their architecture
and design have all target ports automatically mapped to LUNs and are
returning the initiator_target_map, but some of those ports may not be
connected to our HBAs, so we end up with another case of bug #1765000.

This patch makes sure that we always check if the target implements
single WWNN, not only when we don't receive the initiator_target_map.

With this we decrease the likelihood of ending with unexpected devices
in our system, because now we will ignore unconnected HBAs (even if
reported in the initiator_target_map) if we are working with single WWNN
target.

Related-Bug: #1765000
Closes-Bug: #1828440
Change-Id: I02c208142f5b342f894666831449243863eccbfe
(cherry picked from commit 70899a9aa3e4bdd3f1b1a7024807390cd55c4958)
(cherry picked from commit 1ee6acb509910d7de1213fb71cd0d6166991609a)
"}]
commit_message:
FC: Ignore some HBAs from map for single WWNN

Current FC OS-Brick code only checks for single WWNN to exclude some
HBAs from scanning when we don't receive an initiator_target_map from
the backend.

There are storage arrays,like XtremIO, that due to their architecture
and design have all target ports automatically mapped to LUNs and are
returning the initiator_target_map, but some of those ports may not be
connected to our HBAs, so we end up with another case of bug #1765000.

This patch makes sure that we always check if the target implements
single WWNN, not only when we don't receive the initiator_target_map.

With this we decrease the likelihood of ending with unexpected devices
in our system, because now we will ignore unconnected HBAs (even if
reported in the initiator_target_map) if we are working with single WWNN
target.

Related-Bug: #1765000
Closes-Bug: #1828440
Change-Id: I02c208142f5b342f894666831449243863eccbfe
(cherry picked from commit 70899a9aa3e4bdd3f1b1a7024807390cd55c4958)
(cherry picked from commit 1ee6acb509910d7de1213fb71cd0d6166991609a)

Add Python 3 Train unit tests

This is a mechanically generated patch to ensure unit testing is in place
for all of the Tested Runtimes for Train.

See the Train python3-updates goal document for details:
https://governance.openstack.org/tc/goals/train/python3-updates.html
